feed.title: SAP Community - SAP Build Process Automation
feed.subtitle: SAP Build Process Automation Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: Build proces Automation:Assign result to output parameter in Custom script
entry.content:
I have custom script task to read the input from email body contains some key values, each value in newline like " ID : 123

Name : XYZ etc"

I am using the regular expression to match the value and extract it, when I run the same code it is running fine in online script running console.

here i am clueless reagding how to assign the result to output parameter and read the values in another flow task.

entry.title: Mutliple BPA workflows within iRPA automation
entry.content:
So most of the examples I see with regards to executing automation and workflows are in regards to 1 process, as an example executing a workflow for one invoice.

I am attempting to scan a folder that may contain multiple invoices and hence kick off separate workflows for each one. The automation has an option to include a "Process" which I thought would be my workflow process. However the "Process" needs a trigger defined but in this case I was hoping for the automation to simply execute it. Looks like this is not possible? How can my project execute multiple workflows for each run?

Thank you!

entry.title: Queuing of SAP GUI background processes after BPA bot closes session
entry.content:
When the SAP GUI recorder finishes processing by the BPA bot, I notice that multiple SAP GUI icons remain queued in the system tray. Once I hover the mouse over them, they disappear automatically.
My concern is whether these ‚Äúghost‚Äù sessions could cause problems on the machine.
Is there a way to ensure that SAP GUI sessions are completely terminated after the bot closes the connection?

Environment:
SAP Build Process Automation (BTP)
Desktop Agent (version ‚Ä¶)
SAP GUI 7.8 / Logon 800

entry.title: How to handle unexpected pop-up windows in SAP GUI recording with SAP Build Process Automation?
entry.content:
Hello Community,

I am currently working with SAP Build Process Automation (BPA) and I have a recording in SAP GUI that executes a bot.
The issue is that sometimes, when starting the SAP session, an unexpected pop-up window appears (for example due to updates, maintenance, or security certificates). These windows do not always show up, and when they do, they break the bot execution because they are not part of the recording.

What is the best practice to handle such occasional pop-up windows in an SAP GUI recording?
Is there a recommended way to manage them without having to record every possible case manually?

Thank you for your support!

entry.title: SAP Desktop Agent starts and disappears during automation
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

I‚Äôm facing an issue with SAP Intelligent RPA Desktop Agent (v3.32.58, Unattended mode). When I run my automation, the agent starts but immediately disappears without executing, and status goes back to Idle ‚Äì Connected to tenant, waiting for a project to be loaded.

Any guidance on fixing this (reinstall, deployment settings, or log checks) would be appreciated.

Thanks!

entry.title: Passing a LIST between Automations
entry.content:
(re-posting here because not getting much traction under "Tooling (+ SAP Build) Forum").

I've been trying to pass data out (output) of an Automation, into another one, and I'm not able to.  My Output Parameter was always blank.  I had to merge my logic into a single Automation to achieve my solution.

Sample Process:

Parameters of getData Automation:

I found some info that the best way to read from a local Excel file is to use the Excel Cloud Link activity, which is recommended to use a "any" type variable.  This type of variable does not seem to support LISTS either.  I then learned that the TRY statement creates an isolated local "visibility" layer, so I created my "global" variable outside this TRY later.  I tried different ways to pass the Excel data to my global variable (both work) but I cannot pass the data to my Automation Output Parameter.

Can someone please confirm that LISTS of type ANY/Custom are not supported as Parameters of Automations?

Thank you.

entry.title: SAP GUI Automation within SAP BPA Workflow Process
entry.content:
Hello everyone, 

I am building a process in SAP Build Process Automation where:

  • A user manually fills an input form and clicks Submit. Based on the input dropdown/select values and other conditions, the workflow should trigger automation that perform a sequence of steps inside SAP GUI (open transaction, input fields, save).

What I want to know/Problems i am trying to solve:

  1. Can I include SAP GUI recording-based automation inside a BPA workflow? 
  2. Should I design this as attended or Unattended? Which is best fit when the workflow must continue after form submission without user interaction?
  3. Any best practices for login, error handling, and scaling such automations?
  4. Would it be better to use APIs instead of GUI automation when possible?

Any ample patterns (form --> workflow --> automation --> email) would be very helpful.

Thanks in advance.

entry.title: Build process automation : Error adding MDG approval and visualization from trial account
entry.content: I have a BTP trial account. Have default identity provider and custom identity provider set up with necessary roles. Subscribed to SAP build process automation and succesful in launching it. But trying to add Master Data process approval and visualization, leads to error with text  'An error occured. Please create an incident with component CA-AP.'

entry.title: iRPA job keeps on failing
entry.content:
Good day,

I am having a problem with one of scheduled jobs in our system. It always fails, for no reason. I checked the result of the job, and it just says "Job has failed: KO". I have checked the trace and it doesn't have any helpful error except just saying irpa.core.KO and no details.

Here is what the trace says:

I have no idea why this is happening or what is causing it. Any help would be greatly appreciated.

Thank you very much!

entry.title: Cant reuse variable within same automation in SAP BPA
entry.content:
Hi all, we are using automation scenario where certain variant is selected in sap gui (row 0 for example) and result of this is sent to defined users. Both variant row and email recipients are later defined in environment variables. In IRPA (predecessor of BPA) these variables were always defined when creating scenario trigger, so it was possible to define them for each new trigger. Now in BPA this seems to be not working as variables need to be defined when deploying the scenario. 

I wonder if this functionality is gone or is there any other approach how to leverage same scenario and run it with another variables? So far this seems to be like step beck as I would have to clone the same scenario and deploy it only because of another variables.

Many thanks for your answer.

entry.title: bpm.workflowruntime.rest.user.not.sufficient.privileges : Just on API Endpoint /outputs
entry.content:
Dear Folks

  We are using a Service Key (Client ID / Secret / Grant Type = Client Credentials) to access the API resource /workflow/rest/v1/workflow-instances.   Our BPA setup uses an enviroment named PROD with an API Key, where all 19(available at this moment) authorizations are assigned, and all API triggers are deployed successfully.

Everything works fine ‚Äî we are able to create workflow instances, check their status, and retrieve context data via /contexts.

However, we are unable to access the /outputs endpoint ‚Äî this issue occurs consistently across SAP Build Apps, Postman, and even the API Hub.

 

Error is below:  

{"error":{"code":"bpm.workflowruntime.rest.user.not.sufficient.privileges","message":"User does not have sufficient privileges.","logId":"40ff78b6-14e4-40fa-91ec-17d6afe-ap21"}}

 

Able to replicate the same issue even in Trial Account(ap21).

Any suggestion to overcome this issue ? 

thanks !

entry.title: Request failed with status code 503 in SAP BUILD CODE
entry.content:
Hello All,

We‚Äôre trying to connect our backend SAP S/4HANA system with SAP Build Code, but we‚Äôre getting a 503 Service Unavailable error during integration.
Could someone please guide us on what configuration might be missing?

 

Step we followed so far..

1, In BTP Cockpit, Establish a Destination xxx_xx_BuildCode with Basic Authentication with Additional properties as 

sap.processautomation.enabled=true
MobileEnabled=true
WebIDEEnabled=true
WebIDEUsage=odata_abap,dev_abap,odata_c4c,odata_gen,apihub_sandbox
sap.build.usage=odata_gen
HTML5.DynamicDestination=true
isCatalog=true
sap.applicationdevelopment.actions.enabled=true
product.name=SAP S/4HANA
BuildApps.Enabled=true
HTML5.ForwardAuthToken=true
BuildApps.ApiType=odata,rest
appgyver.Enabled=true
Authentication=BasicAuthentication
HTML5.Timeout=60000

2. Verified in BTP Cockpit ‚Üí Destination shows ‚ÄúReachable‚Äù

3. Opened SAP Build App ‚Üí Control Tower ‚Üí Add Destination and successfully added the same destination.

4, Created a project (Web + Mobile) ‚Üí Navigated to Integration tab ‚Üí Add Integration ‚Üí BTP Destination ‚Üí Selected the same destination. At this point, we receive the error:

Has anyone experienced this issue before or can suggest possible reasons for this 503 error?

Thanks in advance.

entry.title: Build Process Automation unattended scenarios in Windows Server 2025?
entry.content:
Hi, I wonder if its possible to run unattended scenarios on remote desktop (virtual machine) that runs on Windows Server 2025?

Current documentation does not mention it:

https://help.sap.com/docs/build-process-automation/sap-build-process-automation/system-requirements-and-technical-prerequisites-831f15b80f9f4793bf8256ed41b70f3a?locale=en-US

Thank you.

SAP Build Process Automation

entry.title: SAP BUILD Issue with Budget Approval Template ‚Äì Missing Field in POST api API_FINPLANNINGDATA_SRV
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

We‚Äôre currently working with the Budget Approval Template:
Workflow Budget Approval

At the end of the process, it performs a POST to the API_FINPLANNINGDATA_SRV service:
API_FINPLANNINGDATA_SRV

Initially, we faced an error related to the company field, which we resolved by following this note:
üîó SAP Note 3550655 - Company field issue

Now, we‚Äôre encountering a Budget error. After following this note and testing directly in Postman, the POST works correctly:
üîó SAP Note 3564398 - Budget error resolution

However, the issue is that the field PlanDataRplcScopeFieldsString is not available in the Build Action because it‚Äôs missing in the POST schema.
This means SAP Build currently doesn‚Äôt allow us to send this field, even though it‚Äôs required ‚Äî so it seems the POST definition and the template need to be updated by SAP.

At this point, it looks like my only workaround is to create a new custom action in Build Process Automation and manually include this field in the POST body.

Has anyone found another solution or workaround for this issue?

PS: The Build Automation template also has a mapping error when approval is not needed ‚Äî the POST mapping is incorrect in that case as well.

Thanks in advance for any insights!
